reasoning: X-linked recessive color blindness affecting red-green perception. Global prevalence ~8% in males (8000/100k), 0.4% in females (400/100k); weighted average ~4500/100k. Well-established genetic disorder with consistent epidemiological data.
source: Neitz J & Neitz M. (2011). The genetics of normal and defective color vision. J Ophthalmol. 2011:321639
